tit.e: In no Kinshin (the retired Emperor's courtier)
In no Kinshin (the retired Emperor's courtier)
In no Kinshin (the retired Emperor's courtier)

sen.j: 院近臣（いんのきんしん、院の近臣）とは、院政を行う治天の君の側近及びその集団の事を指す。
sen.e: In no Kinshin refers to close associate(s) of Chiten no kimi who carried out Insei (rule by the retired emperor).
In no Kinshin refers to the close associates or the group of close associates of Chiten no kimi (the retired emperor in power) who carried out Insei (rule by the retired emperor.)
sen.cmt: 「及びその集団の事」の訳を補いました。「治天の君」の説明を補いました。ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In no Kinshin refers to the close associates or the group of close associates of Chiten no kimi (the retired emperor in power) who carried out Insei (rule by the retired emperor.)

sen.j: 治天の君に仕えた乳母の血縁者や、中流貴族の国司（受領）出身者が多かった。
sen.e: Many of them were blood relatives of menoto (wet nurses) who served Chiten no kimi, or former Zuryo (also called Kokushi; provincial governors).
Many of them were blood relatives of menoto (wet nurses) who served Chiten no kimi, or middle-class nobles who formerly served as Kokushi (also called Zuryo; provincial governors.)
sen.cmt: 「中流貴族」の訳を補い、国司と受領の位置を入れ替えました。
sen.e: Many of them were blood relatives of menoto (wet nurses) who served Chiten no kimi, or middle-class nobles who formerly served as Kokushi (also called Zuryo; provincial governors.)

sen.j: 摂関家に代わって権勢を振るうことが多かった。
sen.e: They often took reins of power instead of the Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They often took reins of power instead of the Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents).
They often took reins of power instead of the Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents).

sen.j: だが、時代が下るにつれて院の近臣間でも権力闘争が起こり、1159年（平治元年）の平治の乱の一因となった。
sen.e: However, as times went by, strife over authority was provoked among In no Kinshin, which was one of the causes of the Heiji War in 1159.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, as times went by, strife over authority arose among In no Kinshin, which was one of the causes of the Heiji War in 1159.
sen.cmt: 自然な訳になるように修正しました。
sen.e: However, as times went by, strife over authority arose among In no Kinshin, which was one of the causes of the Heiji War in 1159.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代中期以後、徳政の推進が院政の課題となってくると、法律や有職に通じて実務に長けた中級貴族の登用が目立つようになった。
sen.e: After the mid Kamakura period when the promotion of benevolent rule became a subject of the Insei, practical middle rank nobles with full knowledge of laws, court rules, ceremony and decorums were often appointed as In no Kinshin.
